text:
Aeroflot named among fastest growing European airlines
PJSC Aeroflot (Moscow Exchange ticker: AFLT) is pleased to have been named Europe’s fourth fastest growing airline by increase in passenger traffic in 1H 2015 by the authoritative publication Airline Business.
Aeroflot – Russian Airlines recorded RPK growth of 9.6% year-on-year in 1H 2015, faster than the global average of 5.9% and significantly ahead of peers including Lufthansa, Air France-KLM, British Airways and Swiss.
“Independent international research has once again confirmed that Aeroflot is a truly global company with genuine leadership potential,” Aeroflot CEO Vitaly Saveliev said. “Despite a challenging economic context we have continued to deliver outstanding results, as well as our ability to respond to the biggest challenges we face.”
The Russian flag carrier’s continued focus on operational efficiency has delivered dynamic growth of passenger traffic as measured by RPKs – a key operational indicator for the airline industry – despite an overall decline in the Russian aviation market and economic headwinds.
Aeroflot remains on track to deliver ahead of schedule on the ambitious goals set out in its Strategy 2025 to rank among Europe’s top five and the global top 20 airlines by RPKs and revenue. In July, Airline Business’s World Airline Rankings placed Aeroflot fifth in Europe by revenue, while Air Transport World ranked Russia’s national carrier in the global top 20 by RPKs for the first five months of 2015.
